intro: Clinopodium grandiflorum subsp. baborense, commonly known as the Baborean betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, violet-blue flowers arranged in dense terminal clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are aromatic, with a mint-like scent, and are often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
